ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GOES 14 Triaxial Fluxgate Magnetometer data at 1 min Resolution in Spacecraft Coordinates
ResourceHeader.Description: The triaxial fluxgate magnetometer, located at a few 10s of meters away from the spacecraft, was designed to provide the orthogonal components of the magnetic field: Hp was parallel to the spin axis that was held nearly in the direction of Earth's axis, He was directed toward Earth center, and Hn pointed eastward. The magnetometer had a range of +/- 1000 nT (without saturation) and a resolution of 0.1 nT. Data files contain long descriptive header.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA-Office of Space Science Applications (United States); NOAA National Environmental Satellite Service (United States); Dr. Howard J. Singer

InformationURL.Name: GOES N, O, and P Brochure
InformationURL.Description: Information about the magnetometers onboard GOES 14.

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to the GOES 14 magnetic field sensor data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to the GOES 14 Magnetic Field Monitor data in CSV format as well as the magnetometer data from other GOES spacecraft. The data are sorted by year, month, spacecraft, and file type. The file names indicates the data type, spacecraft number, year, month, and resolution. For example, g08_magneto_1m_19950201_1995_02_28.csv, indicates goes 8 magnetometer data at 1 min resolution from Feb 1, 1995 to Feb 28, 1995.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: NASA; NOAA; Dr. Howard J. Singer

TimeSpan.Note: Data file may fill out the first month and last month with flags. Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.

Parameter.Name: Seconds of the Month
Parameter.Description: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.

Parameter.Name: BX Magnetometer-1 Quality Flag
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: BX Magnetometer-1 Number of Points
Parameter.Description: Data points per average.

Parameter.Name: BX Magnetometer-1
Parameter.Description: Average of the X-component of the magnetic field in sensor coordinates measured by magnetometer-1.
